snippet: Livery-cab drivers in the outer boroughs said that they eked out a meager living as it was, and that converting to a green taxi would cost them thousands and bring more rules.
abstract: New York City is rolling out new fleet of green taxis to expand legal street-hail service beyond Manhattan in major reshaping of city's for-hire transportation industry; livery-cab drivers in outer boroughs who say they eke out meager living as it is are worried that converting to green taxis will cost them thousands of dollars they do not have and subject them to more rules.
lead_paragraph: Livery-cab drivers in the outer boroughs said that they eked out a meager living as it was, and that converting to a green taxi would cost them thousands and bring more rules.

headline.main: With Street-Hail Service Set to Expand, Some Drivers Are Skeptical
headline.print_headline: With Street-Hail Service Set to Expand, Some Drivers Are Skeptical
